intro: Phryganocydia pisoniana, commonly known as the coffee borer beetle, is a species of moth in the family Tortricidae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is primarily associated with coffee plants. The larvae of this species feed on the seeds of coffee berries, causing significant damage to coffee crops. The adult moths are small, with a wingspan of approximately 10–15 millimeters. This pest is a major concern for coffee growers due to its ability to infest and destroy large quantities of coffee beans.
